text:
Hi everybody.

Does anyone have any examples of triggering a server-side response from something like the `onFormSubmit` callback in the form embed code?
I have forms on a resource centre where each form submission triggers an workflow/email with a link to a download document. I’m seeing various issues with email responses not always being received by contacts.

I’d like to be able to trigger an inline form response with a link to the document on the page as well but with some security measures so to speak.

1. the download document is *not* rendered in the website code inspector, either in view source code or devtools
2. the download link is returned in a Fetch/XHR request url
3. the Fetch/XHR request url has some checks to validate that the request was made from a form submission - something like a csrf token
For bonus points I’d like to avoid using jQuery

Thanks


<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>
